results.title: A Mobster Dodged Hit After Hit. His Son Finally Got Him.
results.abstract: Anthony Zottola was convicted of murder-for-hire Wednesday. Prosecutors say he wanted the real estate business of his father, Sylvester, a reputed Bonnano crime family associate.

media.caption: Police investigate the McDonald’s drive-through where Sylvester Zottola died in 2018.
media.copyright: Gregg Vigliotti for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Babies and Infants;Pregnancy and Childbirth;Premature Babies;Drugs (Pharmaceuticals);Regulation and Deregulation of Industry;Food and Drug Administration
results.title: F.D.A. Panel Recommends Pulling Preterm Birth Drug From the Market
results.abstract: In use for 11 years, the drug Makena provided a test case of the agency’s controversial accelerated approval program. A post-market study showed the drug was not effective.

media.caption: The preterm birth drug Makena has been in use for 11 years, but the F.D.A. recommended withdrawing it from the market. The decision was widely viewed as a test of the agency’s “accelerated approval” program.
media.copyright: PeopleImages, via Getty Images

results.title: A K-Pop Star Didn’t High-Five Black Fans. Was It Racism?
results.abstract: The singer Crush apologized for a “misunderstanding” after the exchange, which highlights what experts call K-pop’s uneasy relationship with Black culture.

results.title: These Doctors Admit They Don’t Want Patients With Disabilities
results.abstract: When granted anonymity in focus groups, physicians let their guards down and shared opinions consistent with experiences of many people with disabilities.

results.title: ‘You Don’t Look Anorexic’

results.title: ‘Still Growing Together,’ a Teenage Crush Leads to Marriage
results.abstract: Brittney Adu was smitten when she saw Aaron Canales on the first day of their freshman year of high school. Despite their cultural differences and the trials of a young romance, their love endured.

media.caption: Brittney Adu said she felt like the “president of the entire world” when Aaron Canales asked her to be his girlfriend in 2013. The couple married Sept. 17 at the Lichterman Nature Center in Memphis.

results.title: Webb Telescope Captures New View of ‘Pillars of Creation’
results.abstract: The NASA space observatory’s infrared eye finds out what’s going on within the cloudy cosmic nursery.

media.caption: “Pillars of Creation” captured in NASA’s James Webb Space Telescope’s near-infrared view. The pillars resemble arches and spires rising from a desert, but are filled with semitransparent gas and dust.

results.title: Hurricane Ian Is Blamed for Deadly Bacterial Infections in Florida
results.abstract: An estimated seven people have died from Vibrio vulnificus. The infection can lead to necrotizing fasciitis, when the tissue around a wound dies, sometimes referred to as “flesh-eating bacteria.”
